text: agent: Sure. Any change of address must be reported to the DMV, that's for the address associated with your license and any of your vehicles. user: Can you tell me more about Traffic points and their cost? agent: Traffic points is the system used by DMV to track dangerous drivers. The cost of the traffic points is independent of the DRA, so you get a separate charge based on the total points you accumulate.

agent: This happens quite often with our customers when they don't bring some of the necessary documents or requirements to complete their transactions. The best you can do is to check our website to see if you can do your transaction online so you don't have to go to the DMV Office. user: In case I have a problem with my insurance and your inquiry letter does not resolve the problem, what would happen. agent: In that case, we must suspend the vehicle registration and if the problem continues, your driver's license. More than 300,000 registrations a year are suspended due to failing to maintain insurance.

agent: If you move and don't update your address who won't know about any insurance problem and we'll have to suspend your registration and license. user: Can I leave the state without notifying DMV? agent: Thanks to the communications between states you can resolve any previous problem you have in New York State before registering in the new state.

agent: Since many of our customers tend to forget some document or requirement for their transactions, we recommend that you go first to our website to see if you can do your transaction online, that way you can avoid any hassle from going to the DMV Office. user: Would there be a problem if I leave the state without notifying DMV? agent: You should resolve any pending problem you have here before moving to another state, if you not, you could not get a new license in your new home state.

agent: No, by statute, you must update your address at the DMV whenever you move from your registered address. It's not enough to just write the new address in the back of your license, or inform an officer when getting a ticket, or tell the United States Postal Service. user: How will you contact me about a problem with my insurance? agent: When we detect any problem with your insurance, we'll mail you an insurance inquiry letter to let you resolve the problem.

agent: the cost of the charge you can get from the DMV due to a traffic violation varies according your accumulated traffic points. user: What else could happen if I don't update my address with you guys?. agent: You won't learn about any insurance problem and we'll suspend your registration and license.

agent: No, the DRA and DMV charge are separate charges. user: What if I have an insurance problem and the inquiry letter does not resolve it? agent: In that case, we have to suspend the vehicle registration and, if the problem persists, your license.

agent: DMV will suspend your registration and license.  user: Let's say I get to a new state, I register my vehicle, get my car insurance and all that stuff but my coverage is dropped for any reason. What would DMV do in that case?  agent: We would send you an inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem. We send 500000 inquiry letters a year, so that's covered.
agent: Does your insurance coverage continue? user: Yes I think. I will check again. agent: Already, If coverage is dropped, we mail you about that. So your adress is so important.
agent: we must suspend the vehicle registration user: When do I need to report my address update? agent:  you must report a change of address to DMV within ten days of moving
agent: Has your insurance lapsed? user: Yes agent: We mail you an insurance inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem

agent: Your license and registration will be suspended. user: Will that happen automatically, or will I get a chance to reinstate my coverage first? agent: You will be sent an inquiry letter first, then if it isn't resolved your registration will be suspended.

agent: We can supply you with the name and business address of the Dial-In account holder and the time, date and search criteria they used for the records. user: Just to check the address of contact is correct please tell me if this is the right one: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137 agent: Yes, that's correct.

agent: The first deposit have to be enough to pay for two months of searches. user: What is the contact address for problems related to my dial-in search account? agent: you can mail the DMV to NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137

agent: Yes, there's a fee that we must charge according to the NYS Vehicle and Traffic Law. This fee applies to private persons, commercial organizations and not-for-profit organizations. user: Do I need anything specific if I perform a search on behalf of a client? agent: You'll have to show permissible use of your client and your client-agent relationship.

agent: The most common clients are attorneys, security personnel, insurance and private investigators and process servers. user: How can I verify if my browser is compatible? agent: You can visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ , there you will be informed if your browser is incompatible.

agent: We need to verify the compliance of the dial-in Terms of Service. user: Would the dial-in search account service be useful for an attorney? agent: Yes, attorneys are among our most common clients.

agent: Customers must include a deposit with the application and the first deposit should be enough to pay for the first 2 months of searches. user: Can you repeat the address where I should send the form? agent: Yes, the address is Data Services - New Search AccountNYS Department of Motor Vehicles6 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228

agent: Yes, we upgraded our security for better protection of the data. So, now you can't download any form as you usually did, to request a form you have to contact DMV. user: Can I visit the page with mi phone?  agent: Yes, most of smart phones have compatible browsers. Visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ to check that.

agent: To solve your problem with your Dial-in Search Account, you must contact us at: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228. user: I understood that records of searches are private, is this true? agent: No, records of searches are public records.

agent: In case that occurs, just update you browser to its newer version and try accessing once again. user: I'll do that, thanks. One more question, if i request some searches being delivered to me via mail-order, do i need to pay  for them in which way, please? agent: In that case, you can use you account balance to make the corresponding payment for those mail-order searches.

agent: If something like that happens, you first need to check whether other users of your account did the search. If that is not the case, you need to contact the DMV immediately to inform about this. user: If I searched a motorist records, will the DMV tells the owner of the records? agent: Yes. This is because, the records of searches are public records and the DMW will inform the motorist if the motorist ask the DMV.

agent: We would subtract the fee from the balance in your account. user: Does security protocols update relates to browser compatibility? agent: Yes. In order to better protect your data, we need to update it. Updating the security protocols means that latest version of browser is needed to enable the updates to be executed.
agent: there are some organizations that are exempt from search fees user: what is their phone number? agent: 473-2137
agent: For more information, please visit our Escrow Accounts page. user: How do I apply? agent: Go to Data Services - New Search Account  NYS Dept of Motor Vehicles.

agent: Any public road counts so you have to get insurance coverage. user: With how many names can I register a vehicle? agent: There're only 1 or 2 names allowed on a registration registrant. Both, the primary registrant and the co-registrant must sign the vehicle registration and provide proof of identity and date of birth.

agent: Yes, if you are going to use your motorcycle on a public road or highway, you must have insurance coverage. user: What should I take into consideration for my liability insurance coverage? agent: Your liability insurance coverage must remain in effect for as long as your registration is valid, there are exceptions for motorcycles.

agent: yes, the names must match in both documents. user: Can I submit copies or faxes of my Insurance identification card to the DMV? agent: yes, you can. But take into consideration that the card will be rejected if the DMV barcode reader can not scan the barcode.

agent: Yes. If you plan to ride your motorcycle on any public road or highway, you must have insurance coverage. user: So can I use a copy or fax of my Insurance Identification Card to give it to the DMV? agent: We do accept copies and faxes of Insurance identification cards, just make sure that the barcode is perfectly legible or it will get rejected if the DMV barcode reader can't scan it.

agent: Yes, the names must be the same in both documents. user: will the insurance company give insurance proof after getting the insurance? agent: yes, the insurance company will issue proof of insurance in two ways.

agent: Once the DMV barcode reader can read scan the barcode on your Insurance Identification Card, this will be acceptable user: What type of policy do I need to have in place before I can register a vehicle? agent: Auto insurance liability is a pre-requisite before you can register a vehicle in New York

agent: New York law requires that you have auto liability insurance coverage with a minimun amount of liability coverage of $10,000 for property damage for a single accident. user: Can there be 2 different names in the vehicle registration? agent: There can only be 1 or 2 names on a registration registrants. Fill and sign the form Vehicle Registration/Title Application PDF  MV-82 and provide their proofs of identity and date of birth. Both names must appear on the Insurance ID Card.

agent: Yes, they accept faxes or copies. Don't worry about that. However, if the barcode is not readable DMV won't accept it.  user: Thanks! One more question, I was living in a different State a few months ago, so I have an Insurance coverage from another state, If I want to register my vehicle here in new york can that out-of-state insurance be accepted?  agent: No, those documents are not accepted. If you want to register a car in New York, it MUST have a New York State insurance coverage.

agent: Motorcycles are the black sheep in the family:Your motorcycle must have insurance coverage any time it is operated on a public road or highway. Unlike most other motor vehicles, motorcycles are registered for one year rather than two. By any means your motorcycle should operate on public highways without liability coverage in effect.
 user: When do my motorcyle registration expire?  agent: On April 30.

agent: Yes but please make sure the barcode on the document is clear because the DMV will not accept a card that the DMV barcode reader could not read. user: What if the name on my vehicle registration application and Insurance Identification Card does not match? agent: You could not proceed with the registration.

agent: yes
 user: Do I have to get my insurance from New York? Do you accept out-of-state insurance? agent: No, we do not accept out-of-state insurance. The insurance must be from New York

agent: Yes, your location apply to the vehicle use tax for all passenger registrations and renewals. user: tell me about the sales tax, how can I determine the fee? agent: For this, you should add 3.25% to the fee listed on the cart and then change the result to the nearest 0.25$

agent: You can ask the city or county where you reside or have a business. user: What charts should I use to determine the fees for commercial vehicles? agent: You have to use the registration fee and the county use tax charts.

agent: You can ask the city or county where you currently reside or have your business. user: I want to know more about the registration fee chart. agent: The fees on this chart are for commercial vehicles that are less than 18000 lbs in weight. For diesel commercial vehicles that are 8501 pounds or more in weight, there is an additional fee.

agent: This chart shows the use taxes and supplemental fees for all the original registrations and renewals. user: And what if I'm from New York City and exempt from the NYC vehicle use tax? agent: Go and get the form UT-11 from a local DMV or from a DMV Call center

agent: You can ask your city or county about these taxes. user: Help me determine the correct fee. agent: ok, you have to add 3.25% to the fee listed in the chart and then change the value you get to the nearest 0.25$.

agent: Yes, you must pay a vehicle use tax when they register a commercial vehicle, To pay your vehicle taxes, you must go to the nearest DMV office or your preferred one. user: I'm a little lost, I don't know anything about paying my vehicle taxes or where to go. agent: Don't worry,  ask in your city or county where you reside.

agent: You can ask the city or county where you reside. They will help you.  user: Ok, because it seems that I am exempt from the vehicle use tax in my county. agent: If you are exempt from the vehicle use tax, please complete the form UT-11C.

agent: You must pay a vehicle use tax when you register a commercial vehicle or renew a commercial vehicle registration if you are residents of New York City. The DMV is responsible for collecting all taxes in the city and its counties. user: How can I know the fee I must pay? agent: Add 3.25% to the fee listed in the chart and change the result to the nearest $0.25.

agent: This chart shows the use taxes and supplemental fees for registrations and renewals. For the sales taxes, it depends on the purchase price and your locality. You can get more info about the sales tax rates by jurisdiction  at the Department of Taxation and Finance website user: What if I'm from New York City and exempt from the vehicle use tax? agent: for that case, get the form UT-11 from a local DMV office or a DMV call center.

agent: 
obtain form UT-11 from a local DMV office [1] or a Call Center user: 
Is New York an exempt city? agent: Yes, New York Bronx, Kings (Brooklyn), Nueva York (Manhattan), Queens, Richmond (Staten Island).
agent: For some counties outside of New York City, there is a use tax.  Refer to the chart. user: Ok thank you. agent: Hope this has been helpful.

agent: Yes, you can. There's more info about this in the section " special procedures to surrender plates for a season - temporary surrender of plates" user: How should I mail my plate so I can get the FS-6 T receipt? agent: You should send the plate via registered or certified mail and request a return receipt, that way you can be notified by the US Postal Service that we received the plate.

agent: No, unless that person is going to surrender your plates for you. user: What would be the date used as the surrendered plates date? agent: The date we use for the surrendered plate dates is the mail postmark date.
agent: What should I do about it? user: I can't surrender my plates. agent: Just report the destroyed plates and surrender the registration. Later the DMV will give you a new registration and plates.

agent: You have to report the stolen plates and surrender the registration, then the DMV will give you new registration and plates. user: how should I mail my surrendered plates? agent: mail the plates by registered or certified mail and ask for a return receipt.

agent: Just if that friend will surrender the plates for you. user: What form should I fill to surrender my plates? agent: The Plate Surrender Application PD-7 for each set of plates you are surrendering, you must to bring the plates and the form PD-7 to a DMV office.

agent: We will mail you your FS-6 T receipt user: Awesome! One last question, is it necessary to surrender trailer plates? agent: If the trailer has no valid registration, you MUST surrender the plate.

agent: No problem. Have you lost your plates? Or this have been stolen from you or got destroyed? user: Yeah, well, they were stolen from my vehicle some day ago. agent: I see. In that case, you need report those plates along with your registration. The DMV can issue to you a new registration and plates if everything is in order.

agent: In that case, you need to report the plate as "stolen, lost or destroyed" and immediately surrender the registration. DMV will issue you a new plate and registration.  user: What if I'm in an another state? Would it be a problem? Or can I do the whole process by mail as if I was here? agent: You have to go to that state's DMV agency and surrender them there, but you can still surrender them by mail. Just make sure, you are in that specific state when you are in the DMV website.

agent: You will need to check the plates. Plate attached with plate frames and fasteners will not be accepted. user: For lost, stolen or destroyed plates, can i get a new one using the old registration? agent: No. You need to surrender the registration and a new registration and plates will be issued after that by the DMV.

agent: Have they been lost or stolen? user: Yes stolen agent: Then you need to report plates that are lost , stolen or destroyed and surrender the registration. In these cases the DMV can issue you a new registration and plates

agent: Yes there is the Complete the PD-7 application that is available as a PDF online. user: Can I submit that online or do I have to print it up and give it to him to bring in? agent: Yes you can submit the form online.
agent: you must complete the plate surrender application PDE user: do motorcycles have a liability? agent: the dmv can issue you a new registration and plates.

agent: Yes, he is eligible to get a reduced fee or even "No Fee" ID card. user: What would apply to him? he also receives SSI. agent: Well, for his case, he receives SSI and is over 62 years old, he can get the "No Fee" renewal. The fee for those under 62 is $6.50.
agent: You'll just have to pay the regular fee for renewing your non-driver ID card. user: so, for renewing online the fee is? agent: Just the normal fees paid for a non-driver ID card renewal.

agent: you have to apply for an original non-driver ID card. user: My Temporary Visitor status was recently extended, what should I do now? agent: Go to a DMV office with your updated paperwork from the DHS. We'll use your updated paperwork to update our records to show that your status has been extended so you can renew your non-driver ID card. Your new card will show the new temporary visitor expiration date.

agent: You have to get a new original non-driver ID card. user: I need to renew but I'm planning on going on a trip soon. agent: We recommend you to renew before your trip so you can get an Enhanced or REAL ID, and avoid another visit to the office later.

agent: You must follow the steps that I will indicate and complete the renewal notice MV-2 we mailed you. user: My non-driver ID expired 3 years ago, is this a problem? agent: Don't worry, we can solve it. You must apply for an original non-driver ID card. You can see the steps you should take in "Get a non-driver ID card NDID".

agent: If you are 60 years old,, your fee is $ 6.50. user: I am somewhat busy and prefer to renew my Standard by mail. There is a problem with that? agent: If you renew by mail, your new ID will show: "NOT FOR FEDERAL PURPOSES".

agent: Yes, I can confirm that information is correct. user: If I am out of the country, how will the Department of Motor Vehicles contact me if they required additional information? agent: It is a requiredment of the Department of Motor Vehicles that if you are overseas you must renew your non-drivers ID card through the mail. You will be including your overseas address with this application for their records.

agent: That will depend if you meet the requirements. For reduced fee ID you have to being on receiving supplemental security income and to be under sixty two, which would get you a $6.50 fee. user: Ok, and what about fees if i renew via online? agent: In that case, you'll have to pay the normal fees applying to a non-driver ID card renewal process.

agent: you have to surrender the vehicle plate and the unused registration sticker and stop at your local DMV office and request a 2-year refund. user: My registration sticker is attached to the vehicle windshield, is that a problem? agent: yes, you can't remove the sticker and can't apply for a full refund.

agent: Check your Receipt FS-6T, there you can find out if you are eligible for a refund. user: so, what amount would be the refund in the example case? agent: in the example, from the 137.50$ paid and if you surrender your vehicle plates during the first year of the registration, you'll qualify for a 30.25$ refund.

agent: Yes, you may be eligible to apply for the first year of the registration fee refund. You have a maximum 60 days after the date you got issued the registration to apply for the first year of the registration fee refund. user: If the registrant died is it possible to get a refund? agent: Yes, in that case, the DMV will issue the refund to the name of the state. You'd have to surrender the vehicle plates at a DMV office and ask for a transfer receipt.

agent: You can't apply for a full refund if you attached the sticker, you can't remove it. user: What is needed in order to apply for a full 2-year refund? agent: The full 2-year refund can only be applied if the registration was never used and it's been no more than 60 days since the date the registration was issued. A processing fee of 1$ is deducted from the refund amount.

agent: The 2-year registration fee refund can only be applied if the registration was never used and it hasn't been more than 60 days from the date the registration was issued. user: So if I applied for a registration but never used the registration sticker, can I get a 2-year refund? agent: yes, you can apply for a refund of the 2-year fee you paid when you renewed the registration.

agent: If a person dies, a refund for the registration of the vehicle is issued to the estate of the person by the DMV. The plates must be surrendered at the DMV office and a transfer receipt requested instead of a refund receipt user: Wat happens if the registration sticker belonging to the deceased is attached to the windshield or the vehicle plate of the vehicle in question? agent: If the registration sticker of the deceased is attached to the windshield or vehicle plate of the registered vehicle, it can not be removed a refund applied for

agent: You must still surrender the vehicle plates at a DMV office, but request a transfer receipt, not a refund receipt.  You will then send that to the address of the Request for Refund MV-215 form along with the completed and signed Request for Refund [1] MV-215 and proof of the name change such as a marriage certificate, divorce certificate, or other court papers.   At that point, the DMV will issue your refund in your new name if you are eligible.  user: Will the DMV issue a refund if the registrant died?  agent: The DMV will issue the refund to the name of the estate if the plates are surrendered at the DMV office and a transfer receipt is requested and the executor of the estate sends a completed and signed Request for Refund [1]MV-215, with "deceased" written on the form, a photocopy of the death certificate, and the transfer certificate to the address listedon the Request for Refund MV-215.

agent: sure, you can apply for a refund for the amount that you paid when you renewed your registration user: can i get a refund if i change my name? agent: yes, that shouldn't be a problem, you will just need to surrender the vehicle plates at a DMV office and request a transfer receipt
agent: dmv will process a refund of the first year if eligible user: how can i get a refund? agent: your receipt FS-6 T indicatiates if you are eligible to receive a refund

agent: When you surrender them, your receipt FS-6 indicates if you are eligible to receive a refund. user: If the sticker was attached to the windshield or vehicle plate of a registrant who has died, can we get a refund? agent: You cannot remove the sticker and apply for a refund.

agent: Once you get your learner permit you should always obey the permit restrictions on where and when you may drive. Then you have to complete a 5-hour pre-licensing course. user: What should I do in case I lost my certificate? agent: You have to contact the school that issued the certificate to obtain another one.

agent: To amend the class on your license, there is no need to have a Pre-Licensing Course Certificate, provided you have a valid NY State driver license user: What proof of supervise driving practice do I need to bring with me to the driver test agent: You must present a Certificate of Supervised Driving MV-262 to the license examiner. This Certificate is completed by your parent of guardian which certifies that you have the required amount of supervised driving practice

agent: You have to wait for at least six months from the date you received your learner permit to schedule a road test. user: What should I do in case I lost my certificate? agent: You must contact the school that issued the certificate, they will give you a replacement.

agent: A minimum of 50 hours that includes at least 15 hours of driving after sunset before you take a road test, and you must bring to the road test a completed Certification of Supervised Driving MV-262 signed by your parent or guardian. user: What do I need to change the class of my license? agent: You need just a valid NY State driver license and you apply to amend to another license Class.

agent: You should contact the school that issued it to obtain a replacement.  user: One more question,as I want to get a motorcycle license do I need additional requirements? agent: Yes, there are additional requirements. You can visit www.getamotorcylelicense.com to see them.

agent: Very well, that's important. Well, as you are under 18, the minimum hour requirement would be 50 hours of supervised practice driving. user: Wow, that much, huh?. Well, thanks. Oh, please, could you tell if i would need to have a pre-licensing certificate in case i need to change my license class sometime? agent: That would be a no. If you are in possesion of an valid NY State driver license, you don't need to own a pre-licensing course certificate in order to change form one class to another. Just go with your valid NY State license and apply to amend it to another class.

agent: As said before, the course cover many important topics for you as new driver, but for example, a pair of topics would be attitudes and risk taking while driving and other would be use of drugs. user: Um, ok. And before to go on my road test, what i should focus on? agent: Well, you have many topics but for name some of them, you can focus on steering and acceleration, it is pretty much the most important.

agent: No. You don't need a PLCC, as long as you have a valid NY state driver license you can apply to change your class.  user: One more question, you said before that accelerating smoothly and moderately was key, but what if I have to drive on a highway in my test? I can't go moderately, since all the vehicles will be honking since I'm going slow.  agent: Don't worry about that! When you are taking the driving test, your headlights will be on so everyone know you are in a test, also the car we use is a special car and has a logo. So it's ok, just stick to a smoothly and moderately acceleration, and don't force the engine so it does not stall.

agent: Applicants should abide by the relevant speed limits, being mindful of the weather conditions/road conditions/visibility and traffic conditions that are prevalent. An adequate space "cushion" should be kept between yourself and any traffic in front of you. The "two second rule" that is described in the Driver's Manual should be referred to and used user: What should I do if my view is obscured after stopping at a crosswalk during the road test? agent: If your view is obstructed while stopped at a crosswalk, you should move until your view is not obscured and if necessary, you should stop again
user: Yes, please. Where can I take the course? user: Also, what happens if I successfully complete it? agent: For completion of the course you'll receive a Pre-licensing Course Certificate MV-278.

agent: You need to have a minimum of 50 hours of supervised practice driving that includes at least 15 hours of driving after sunset before you take a road test user: Should i practice stop lines and crosswalks for my driving test? agent: Yes you should practice this.
agent: Have you successfully completed the pre-Licensing course? user: No I have not. agent: Once completed you will be given a Pre-Licensing Course Certificate MV-278

agent: no, you have to pay the fine, filing an appeal won't change your obligation to pay the fine. user: What if my traffic ticket does not show the words "Traffic Violations Bureau" at the bottom? agent: It has to display the words "Traffic Violations Bureau" at the bottom of the ticket, if not then you can't file an appeal with the Department of Motor Vehicles.

agent: For that, you need to submit a written "Stay Argument" user: When can I appeal the denial of an application to reopen the default conviction? agent: only after the DMV TVB Default Unit has denied your Application to Reopen a Default Conviction AA-3.3

agent: You can use the TVB Traffic Ticket Appeal service to check the status of your appeal. user: What if I don't want to file the appeal online? agent: Then you can use the Traffic Violations Bureau Appeal AA-33

agent: In that case, you can't file an appeal with the DMV. user: I just sent my appeal by mail, was it already accepted? agent: No,That does not mean that your appeal has already been accepted. This is determinated by the DMV Appeals Board after check the legal requirements of your appeal.

agent: Yeah, it does need to have the words Traffic Violations Bureau on it, more precisely on the bottom of the ticket, or you won't be able to file it on the DMV. user: Ok i'll check on that. One more question, please. After i file the appeal, can i appeal the denial of an application, i mean, my application, in order to reopen the default conviction? agent: Yes, you can, but only after the DMV TVB Default Unit has denied your Application to Reopen a Default Conviction.

agent: If you have some other penalty in addition to your current TVB conviction, you can make use of the Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination to process that. user: Um, ok, i'll have it into account. One last issue, what i need to submit if i'm going to have an attorney to represent me in the appeal? agent: Well, if you are going to use representation, then in the online option, you'll need to submit your attorney's name and mailing address.

agent: Yes. Your appeal will be rected if it does not meet the requirements on NYS law. user: What should i do if i do not need the transcript? agent: If you do not need the transcript, within 10 days of your appeal submission, you need to mail exhibits or arguments. failure in doing that, may result in the documents no be filed with the appeal.
agent: Yes  user: When should the additional argument be submitted  agent: It has to be submitted within 30 days.
agent: You will receve a refund, *if* you cancel the appeal request before it is processed. user: Sounds ok to me, I guess. agent: Is there anything else I can help you with today?

agent: You should first complete the DMV's Document Guide to make sure that you have all the proofs of identification and documents you need before going to the DMV office. user: where should I register my business vehicle? agent: If your business is located in New York then you should register it at the lock DMV office.

agent: Apart from business regulated by DMV, determine if a vehicle was stolen or flooded and know the death of a family member, you can also get tips for buying a vehicle. user: What other information can I get? agent: You can know about abandoned and unclaimed vehicles, apply for Clean Pass that can't be registered in New York, etc.

agent: Certainly could cause you problems to do that. DMV can prevent your vehicle's registration renewal or even suspend such registration, until you are in order again. If that's your case, please take a look of local Traffic Courts. user: Hum,  got it. Lastly, there is any special situations about vehicle registering in NYS? agent: Sure, there is. DMV has some topics under the special situations tag. There is special procedures for agricultural and farm vehicles, homemade vehicles and trailers, or the sad situation of an deceased owner.

agent: No problem. DMV has some resources available. For example, there is Businesses regulated by DMV, as well as Inspection Stations, Dealer and tranportes and even repair shops. Also, you have resources to determine if a car was flooded or stolen and another resource for in case a family member dies. user: Glad to know you have those in any case i need it..Sorry, but can you check on me for my earlier question about suspensions?. It was parking tickets and toll violations, isn't? agent: Totally correct.You have available information on those topics.
agent: You must register any vehicle owned by your business at a DMV office.  user: Where do I place my registration sticker?  agent: The sticker should be placed on your windshield.

agent: Do any special situations apply to you, such as farm vehicles, no title or more than one owner? user: Yes, it's a farm vehicle. agent: The procedure for registering that will be slightly different, so come to the office and we can walk you through it.

agent:  null user: Btw, I know that here in New York the safety guideliness are a bit different from texas. Where can I learn more about motorcycle safety? agent: Motorcycle safety information is available from the New York State Governor's Traffic Safety Committee.
